qas.question: In what year did Paramount Pictures purchase DreamWorks?
What Universal chairperson headed DreamWorks as of 2006?
Who became the chairperson in late 2009?
Who was the founder of Universal Partnerships & Licensing?
Who became chairperson of Universal Pictures in September 2013?
What company did Viacom acquire in 2005?
What company did Stacey Shmuger leave in 2006?
What position did Donna Sperber hold?
Who was ousted as co-chairman of Universal Pictures in October 2013?

context: In late <a0_0>2005<a0_0/>, Viacom's Paramount Pictures acquired <b5_0>DreamWorks SKG<b5_0/> after acquisition talks between GE and DreamWorks stalled. <b6_0>Universal<b6_0/>'s long time chairperson, <a1_0>Stacey Snider<a1_0/>, left the company in early 2006 to head up DreamWorks. Snider was replaced by then-Vice Chairman Marc Shmuger and Focus Features head David Linde. On October 5, 2009, Marc Shmuger and David Linde were ousted and their co-chairperson jobs consolidated under former president of worldwide marketing and distribution <a2_0>Adam Fogelson<a2_0/> becoming the single chairperson. <a4_0>Donna Langley<a4_0/> was also upped to <b7_0>co-chairperson<b7_0/>. In 2009, <a3_0>Stephanie Sperber<a3_0/> founded Universal Partnerships & Licensing within Universal to license consumer products for Universal. In September 2013, <b8_0>Adam Fogelson<b8_0/> was ousted as co-chairman of Universal Pictures, promoting Donna Langley to sole-chairman. In addition, NBCUniversal International Chairman, Jeff Shell, would be appointed as Chairman of the newly created Filmed Entertainment Group. Longtime studio head Ron Meyer would give up oversight of the film studio and appointed Vice Chairman of NBCUniversal, providing consultation to CEO Steve Burke on all of the company's operations. Meyers still retains oversight of Universal Parks and Resorts.
